models.model_description: Neural network-based information-theoretic framework for learning G-P maps on one-hot encoding
models.reference: Tareen A, Kooshkbaghi M, Posfai A, et al. MAVE-NN: learning genotype-phenotype maps from multiplex assays of variant effect[J]. Genome biology, 2022, 23(1): 98.

models.model_description: Utilizes a Geometric Vector Perceptron architecture to extract feature from structure
models.reference: Chen L, Zhang Z, Li Z, et al. Learning protein fitness landscapes with deep mutational scanning data from multiple sources[J]. Cell Systems, 2023, 14(8): 706-721. e5.

models.model_description: Ridge regression model on one-hot encoding
models.reference: Dallago C, Mou J, Johnston K E, et al. FLIP: Benchmark tasks in fitness landscape inference for proteins[J]. bioRxiv, 2021: 2021.11. 09.467890.

models.model_description: Simple convolutional network on one-hot encoding
models.reference: Dallago C, Mou J, Johnston K E, et al. FLIP: Benchmark tasks in fitness landscape inference for proteins[J]. bioRxiv, 2021: 2021.11. 09.467890.

models.model_description: Model with a Transformer encoder architecture trained with a Masked-Language Modeling objective on UniRef50
models.reference: Rives, A., Goyal, S., Meier, J., Guo, D., Ott, M., Zitnick, C.L., Ma, J., & Fergus, R. (2019). Biological structure and function emerge from scaling unsupervised learning to 250 million protein sequences. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America, 118.

models.model_description: Model with a Transformer encoder architecture trained with a Masked-Language Modeling objective on UniRef90
models.reference: Meier, J., Rao, R., Verkuil, R., Liu, J., Sercu, T., & Rives, A. (2021). Language models enable zero-shot prediction of the effects of mutations on protein function. NeurIPS.

models.model_description: Models pairwise evolutionary couplings between protein sequences using a Potts model
models.reference: Hopf, T.A., Ingraham, J., Poelwijk, F.J., Sch√§rfe, C.P., Springer, M., Sander, C., & Marks, D.S. (2017). Mutation effects predicted from sequence co-variation. Nature Biotechnology, 35, 128-135.
Dallago C, Mou J, Johnston K E, et al. FLIP: Benchmark tasks in fitness landscape inference for proteins[J]. bioRxiv, 2021: 2021.11. 09.467890.

models.model_description: Uses a VAE architecture to learn higher-order non-linear evolutionary constraints within protein family
models.reference: Riesselman, A.J., Ingraham, J., & Marks, D.S. (2018). Deep generative models of genetic variation capture the effects of mutations. Nature Methods, 15, 816-822.
